graphics.utilities

Class AnimationEventController

  • java.lang.Object
    • graphics.utilities.AnimationEventController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class AnimationEventController
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    AnimationEventController is a holder and executor of events. It can hold multiple animations(or events) each with multiple keyframes(or states). The controller can be run on it's own thread or step by step using step function.
    It calculates the current state of the animation based on 2 states and a progress float.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    OSM Group 5 - DollyWood project
    See Also:
    AnimationEvent, AnimationState

      • loadEvent

        public void loadEvent(java.lang.String filename,
             java.lang.String animationID,
             org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f position,
             org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f rotation,
             org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f scale,
             float speed)
               throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Loads a non-binary .ani file and returns the AnimationEvent within.
        A .ani file consists primarily of 5 fields. and looks like the following
        o string with model name
        p x.x y.y z.z //Position vector
        r x.x y.y z.z //Rotation vector
        sc x.x y.y z.z //Scale vector
        s x.x //Speed of the keyframe.
        These field should appear in this order, and can be repeated for each keyframe.
        You can then specify if the animation should loop with the string:
        lt LOOP
        Parameters:
        filename - Location of the .ani file
        position - Position offset. This is where the animation will be centered
        rotation - Rotation offset.
        scale - Scale offset. Note that they should be 0.0, if a final scale of 1.0 is desired
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
